question_text: What is the purpose of the TRIM command in SSD operation?
answer_options: It defragments the SSD for better performance
It allows deleted blocks to be marked for future overwrite
It slows wear leveling by pausing writes
correct_answer: It allows deleted blocks to be marked for future overwrite
explanation: TRIM lets the OS inform the SSD which blocks are no longer in use, helping the drive maintain performance and lifespan.
